D:/GDA/gda-trunk/users/scripts/Introduction_to_scanning.py

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #
00002 #  Scanning
00003 #
00004 
00005 #  The scanning mechanism does not currently include continuous scanning, but this will be 
00006 #  added in the future.
00007 
00008 #  Scans are defined using the GDA Jython syntax.  They are not performed using pure Jython.
00009 # A scan has a list of objects which are operated during the scan, and a list of detectors which are read out at each point in the scan
00010 # Only Scannable objects may be controlled in a scan.  Scannables include the DOFs which make up Optical Elements (OEs)
00011 
00012 # for example, to raise a sample vertically and collect data at each point:
00013 scan samplevertical 5 10 1 countertimer01
00014 # this will collect data at heights 5,6,7,8,9,10  (start, stop, step)
00015 
00016 # you can operate more than one scannable in a scan
00017 scan samplevertical 5 10 1 sampleyaw 20 1 countertimer01
00018 #this is set the sample rotation to 20 degrees initialy and move it by 1 degree when the sample hieght is moved  (start, step)
00019 
00020 # whereas:
00021 scan samplevertical 5 10 1 sampleyaw 20 countertimer01
00022 # will set the sample rotation to 20 initially and not move it again (start)
00023 
00024 # and:
00025 scan samplevertical 5 10 1 sampleyaw countertimer01
00026 # will senot move the sample rotation, but will record its current position in the output data
00027 
00028 # to perform a 2D scan, give the other scannable three arguments:
00029 scan samplevertical 5 10 1 sampleyaw 20 30 1 countertimer01
00030 # so this will collect data at all points in the range 5 to 10 in height and 20 to 30 in rotation
00031 
00032 
00033 
00034 #default objects:
00035 
00036 # to include a detector or a scannable in every scan, without having to type it in the command-line, there is a list of default object
00037 list defaults
00038 
00039 # to have the same detector called in every scan:
00040 add default countertimer01
00041 #now you will not have to type the detector name every time (if you did it would not matter)
00042 
00043 #to remove an object from the list of defaults:
00044 remove default countertimer01
00045 
00046 
00047 # Other types of scans will become available, such as peak finding scans, or when specific hardware is available, continuous scans
00048 #  These will also be controlled via a similar syntax.
